text: Well, the random number generator chose it, not me. But when it did, I noticed and came back and do the optimization :)

IQ featuring his own shader
[img]https://i.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/001/510/176/e33.jpg[/img]
Made it render 1.7x faster by adding some bounding volumes, and also by relaxing my intolerance to certain artifact. Reduced compile time a bit too.
120 FPS on RTX 2080 TI, also the Refraction index change effect (Don't know if there is a term for it) is barely visible if at all on 5120 x 1440 resolution. real good stuff otherwise
[This comment has been hidden by the shader author]
Do you use some kind of converting tool for making this models? Or you are god of procedural elephants? However, it looks great!
37 FPS on GTX1080, really heavy.
changing  texture2DGradEXT() to texture2D() and removing the last 2 vec2's in 'Buf C' and using texture2DGrad() in 'Image' works. Looks great!
changing texture2DGradEXT() to texture2DGrad() works in 'Image' tab but not in the 'Buf X' tabs. It says no matching overloaded function found.
Getting errors about texture2DGradEXT missing
OMG this is awsome.
32 fps on GTX 1080. Also my electricity bill soars towards infinity.
I am surprised that my four years old 660ti is still can render it 10fps, pair with the 960 and gtx 980 ti.
theres one that pushes the limits of hardware as of 2016. no longer realtime but iq never was much fof a fan for realtime and more a fan of compression.

Masterpiece!

8.2fps on a 960.
18fps with Quadro M6000 ^^

'texture2DGradEXT' : no matching overloaded function found
on Firefox on Linux with the proprietary Nvidia driver
20 fps with TitanX :P
Around 10fps with a GTX 980 Ti ;)

Wow! Beautiful work! :)
I also agree with zproxy, IMO it would be awesome to generate textures instead of using fixed ones, creating a pure procedural image. Something like render once buffers, instead of every frame rendering. Maybe just a checkbox in the texture options like "Update [true/false]" like the VFlip.
Again awesome work! :)

awesome. 2fps here. now only if we could do away the texture images and use generated textures.

and then perhaps. animate the animals a bit. :)
WOW! Beautiful! I love it :-)

That leaf is disturbing on the right when rotating.
Nice , so nice !
18-20fps on my imac ... Eccezionale! your math is pure art man!

On less in my TODO list !
So realistic and landscape is incredible also... Iq quality  :D
Awe inspiring, not to mention, mind blowing.

Unknown error: (131, 11): Undeclared identifier 'texture2DGradEXT'.
It won't run here.
This is just incredible iq.  Technical brilliance sure but there's real artistry in that image!  I'm just blown away.  Those elephants feel so real!!  And the tender caress....  Wow.
Just amazing
any chance of replacing texture2DGradEXT ? some systems seem to not have it
incredibruu!
this is amazing - but yeah, this should be the first shader of Shadertoy's lesser known and yet to be conceived cousin 'Rendertoy', my video card could melt steel beams at the moment.
:O
I am flabergasted! :love:

Wow, that's insane! One sees you are a pro!
When do you make a jaguar, my fave animal? ;)

A lovely well lit model scene as usual iq. And a great focus effect. I'd be happy just doing one tree here. :)
I am getting missing bands in the leaves though.

You win; I think 0.4 fps is the lowest I've seen here ;)
Looks nice!
wow, Wow, WOOOW !!
